item.title: [LeetCode] 384. Shuffle an Array
item.author: Debakar Roy
item.description: Shuffle an Array Link to original Problem on LeetCode Shuffle a set of numbers without duplicates. Example: // Init an array with set 1, 2, and 3. int[] nums = {1,2,3}; Solution solution = new Solution(nums); // Shuffle the array [1,2,3] and return its result. Any permutation of [1,2,3] must equally likely to be returned. solution.shuffle(); // Resets the array back to its original configuration [1,2,3]. solution.reset(); // Returns the random shuffling of array [1,2,3].

item.title: [LeetCode] 217. Contains Duplicate
item.author: Debakar Roy
item.description: Contains Duplicate Link to original Problem on LeetCode Given an array of integers, find if the array contains any duplicates. Your function should return true if any value appears at least twice in the array, and it should return false if every element is distinct. Example 1: Input: [1,2,3,1] Output: true Example 2: Input: [1,2,3,4] Output: false Example 3: Input: [1,1,1,3,3,4,3,2,4,2] Output: true Company: Amazon Solution (Using Sorting): Time Complexity: O(n log n) Space Complexity: O(1)

item.title: [LeetCode] 1. Two Sum
item.author: Debakar Roy
item.description: Two Sum Link to original Problem on LeetCode Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. Example: Given nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9, Because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9, return [0, 1].
